text: how do i disable this floating thing on my site? :sweat_smile: i've searched to no avail - i don't even know what to call it
Go to <https://app.HubSpot.com/> and log out …
I realise it's only visible to logged-in users, but it's distracting me while im working on my site and need to be logged in
You can click the icon and select the last menu item to hide the layer …

Hi <@U0100V08F17> that would be our “Sprocket Menu” for quick access to edit a page or perform other actions. Would you be able to post the idea of having a setting to hide the menu at all times to our ideas forum here: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/custom/page/page-id/ideaslandingpage> then post a link back in our <#C26E7JT8V|ideas> channel for others to review and upvote
You should be able to hide the icon if you open up the menu and click on "Hide This Menu".
having the team check this out now
This should be fixed! If not, could you please send me a link to your portal so I can take a look?

Don't know why you'd want to, but if you add this to your stylesheet it won't show any longer.

`.hs-tools-menu.hs-collapsed {`
   `display: none;`
`}`

Has anyone else had issues with the "Site header HTML" section in the content settings? If i add something under the "default settings for all domains" it never works, nothing adds to any of the pages in either domain. It only works if i add it separately to each individual domain instead.
You could also use an extension like ‘magic css’ where you can turn it on and off. It allows you to write css/sass and it adds the css at the end of page and persists on the domain are using
If your individual domain has any settings already it doesn’t bring in the default settings.
Not sure what you are asking about <@UNU1C7MA7>
Is there a way to trigger the “slide-in box left” modal (the one in forms) earlier
I need to use it for a corona virus update
so it needs to appear right away
any hack to make that work?
Ended up re-building it instead

Yeah, I think adding something in teh header would be your best bet. I'm sure you could use JS to add some classes to the modal on document ready and bring it in, but that might cause other issues with the HubSpot script that makes it happen
<@U25PYL3Q8> i'm no sure how many if/then branches (eg in a workflow) you need for getting the month out of a date property... ¿what where you thinking? ¿is there a way to get the month of a date?
Oh ya sorry. Let me think about that In The morning when my brain is fresh. I’ll lay out what I think the logic needs to be
what's the best way to reference images from my stylesheet? my stylesheet is in a /css/ subfolder and images in an /images/folder alongside it. using url(../images/filename.jpg) doesn't work
